ARABIC: إِذْ دَخَلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا۟ سَلَٰمًا قَالَ سَلَٰمٌ قَوْمٌ مُّنكَرُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: When they entered his dwelling and said, 'Peace!' he said, 'Peace, to people we do not know.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: When they came to him, they said: "Peace." He answered: "Peace." They were a people he did not recognise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: When they came to him, they said: “Peace”; he said: “Peace also be to you; (you seem to be) a group of strangers.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: When they came to him saying, "Peace be with you," he replied to their greeting in the same manner and said to himself, "These are a strange people".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: When they came to him and said, “Peace”; he answered, “Peace”; and thought, “These people are not familiar.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: When they came in to him and said: "Salaman!" He answered: "Salamun" and said: "You are a people unknown to me."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: When they entered upon him, they said: Peace. Peace, said he, a strange people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: When they entered unto him, saying 'Peace!' he said 'Peace! You are a people unknown to me.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: When they came in unto him and said: Peace! he answered, Peace! (and thought): Folk unknown (to me).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: When they came to him they said, "Peace!" He answered, "Peace!" [saying to himself]. "They are strangers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: When they came in Unto him, and said:'peace!' he said: 'peace'! - people unknown.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: When they entered into his presence, they said, ‘Peace!’ ‘Peace!’ He answered, ‘[You are] an unfamiliar folk.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Behold, they entered his presence, and said: "Peace!" He said, "Peace!" (and thought, "These seem) unusual people."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: When they came in to him, and said, "Salam, (peace be upon you)!" He answered; "Salam, (peace be upon you)," and said: "You are a people unknown to me,"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: They entered to him and said: 'Peace' And he replied: 'Peace, you are people unknown to me'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: When they entered upon him, they said, “Peace.” He said, “Peace, strangers.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: When they entered upon him and said, "[We greet you with] peace." He answered, "[And upon you] peace, [you are] a people unknown.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [51:25]   When (idh is an adverbial qualifier of hadīthu dayfi, ‘the story of the guests’) they entered upon him and said, ‘Peace!’ — in other words [they said] these very words. He said, ‘Peace!’ — [also] these very words — [These are] an unfamiliar folk, whom we do not know — he said this to himself (qawmun munkarūna is the predicate of an implicit subject such as hā’ūlā’i, ‘these are’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (When they) Gabriel and two other angels with him; and it is also said: Gabriel and 12 other angels with him (came in unto him) to Abraham (and said: Peace!) they gave the greetings of peace to Abraham (he answered, Peace!) Abraham answered their greetings of peace, ((and thought): Folk unknown (to me)) he did not recognize them and did not see that their greeting of peace was unknown at the time and place where he was.
